alert.note: Alert for Escambia Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 347 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Stapleton, or 8 miles northeast of Loxley, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Baldwin and northwestern Escambia Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
